Class ScoreManager

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.managers.ScoreManager
public class ScoreManager extends Object
Manages the player's current score, level progression, and high score tracking.

Architectural Note (SRP): This class strictly handles the logic of scoring (calculating points, determining level ups). It delegates the actual file persistence to ScoreFileHandler to adhere to the Single Responsibility Principle.

Strategy Pattern Support: This manager exposes configuration flags (savingEnabled, levelingEnabled) that allow the active GameMode to enable or disable features (e.g., disabling leveling in Zen Mode) without changing internal logic.

  • Constructor Details

    • ScoreManager

      public ScoreManager()
      Constructs a new ScoreManager.

      Initializes the file handler using the path defined in configuration and immediately loads the current high score from disk.

  • Method Details

    • setSavingEnabled

      public void setSavingEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Configures whether new high scores should be written to disk.

      Called by the GameController when switching modes.

      Parameters:
      enabled - true to enable saving (Normal Mode); false to disable (Zen Mode).

    • setLevelingEnabled

      public void setLevelingEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Configures whether the game level (and speed) should increase as lines are cleared.
      Parameters:
      enabled - true to enable leveling (Normal Mode); false for constant speed (Zen Mode).

    • restoreState

      public void restoreState(int savedScore, int savedLevel)
      Restores the score and level to a previous state. Part of the Memento Pattern for the Undo feature.
      Parameters:
      savedScore - the score value to restore.
      savedLevel - the level value to restore.

    • checkAndSaveHighestScore

      public boolean checkAndSaveHighestScore()
      Checks if the current score beats the high score and saves it if allowed.

      This operation is skipped if savingEnabled is false (e.g., in Zen Mode).

      Returns:
      true if a new high score was set and saved; false otherwise.

    • getHighestScore

      public int getHighestScore()
      Retrieves the highest score loaded from the file.
      Returns:
      the high score integer.

    • scoreProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty scoreProperty()
      Exposes the score property for UI binding.
      Returns:
      the generic IntegerProperty for the score.

    • levelProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty levelProperty()
      Exposes the level property for UI binding.
      Returns:
      the generic IntegerProperty for the level.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the score and level to initial values (0 and 1).

      Also reloads the high score from disk to ensure the session starts with the most up-to-date record.

    • onRowsCleared

      public void onRowsCleared(int linesRemoved)
      Calculates score rewards for clearing lines and handles level progression.

      If levelingEnabled is true, this method checks if the total lines cleared exceed the threshold for the next level and updates the level property accordingly.

      Parameters:
      linesRemoved - the number of lines cleared in a single drop (1-4).

    • onHardDrop

      public void onHardDrop(int rowsDropped)
      Adds points for performing a hard drop.
      Parameters:
      rowsDropped - the number of rows the brick fell instantly.

    • onSoftDrop

      public void onSoftDrop()
      Adds points for performing a soft drop.
